info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 3:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 321 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ridgeland, Grahamville, Gillisonville, Switzerland, Coosawhatchie, Old House, Tillman, Tarboro, Pineland, Robertville, Laurel Bay, Burton, Ricetown and Knowles.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
